title: Create a secure Lorentzian Domain
body: Use LDManager.create_domain(name, security_level='isolated', dimension=4, metric_type='minkowski'). Default workspace name: 'secure-workspace'. Isolated security level ensures complete separation from other domains.

title: Register models as nodes
body: Scan .hypersync/models/*.json. For each meta with `name` and `type`, call ICORouter.register_node(ld_id, node_id=name, address_type=type, coordinates={t:0,x:0,y:0,z:0}). Coordinates default to origin for new nodes.

title: Compute routes between nodes
body: ICORouter.compute_route(src, dst) calculates geodesic paths in 4D spacetime. For flat Minkowski metric, routes are straight lines. For curved metrics, routes follow geodesics. Cross-domain routing requires bridges.

title: Compose multi-model agents
body: CompositionEngine.compose(blueprint) creates composite agents from multiple models. Blueprint requires: name, capabilities list, members list. Agent is automatically registered as a node in the specified domain.

title: Domain isolation and security levels
body: Security levels: 'isolated' (complete separation), 'shared' (controlled access), 'public' (open access). Always use 'isolated' for production. Bridges enable controlled cross-domain communication.

title: Telemetry and PII redaction
body: Telemetry is stored locally in .hypersync/chat/telemetry. PII redaction is enabled by default. Redacts: emails, phone numbers, IP addresses, API keys. Users can disable telemetry in runtime.bootstrap.json.

title: Model descriptor format
body: Model descriptors are JSON files in .hypersync/models/. Required fields: name (string), type (string). Optional: capabilities (array), entrypoint (object), tags (array). Example: {"name":"gpt-4","type":"model","capabilities":["text:generation"]}

title: First-run initialization flow
body: First-run steps: 1) Create secure LD ('secure-workspace'), 2) Scan .hypersync/models/ for descriptors, 3) Register models as nodes, 4) Offer to compose network operator agent. User can skip any step.

title: Geodesic routing in curved spacetime
body: In curved spacetime (Schwarzschild, Kerr metrics), routes follow geodesics. Geodesics minimize proper time. Curvature affects path length and routing efficiency. Flat Minkowski metric uses Euclidean distance.

title: Cross-domain bridges
body: Bridges enable communication between domains. Create with BridgeManager.create_bridge(src_ld, dst_ld). Bridges enforce policy at domain boundaries. Required for cross-domain routing.

title: Policy enforcement
body: PolicyManager enforces policies before all operations. Policies define allow/deny lists for actions. Check policies/nvm/iam.policy.json for IAM permissions. Policy violations throw PolicyViolation exceptions.

title: 4D spacetime coordinates
body: Nodes have 4D coordinates: t (time), x, y, z (space). Origin is (0,0,0,0). Coordinates affect routing in curved spacetime. For flat metrics, coordinates are primarily organizational.

title: Model catalog scanning
body: catalog.models scans .hypersync/models/*.json. Skips invalid JSON. Returns count and model list. Creates directory if missing. Re-scan after adding new descriptors.

title: Agent capabilities and composition
body: Agent capabilities define what the agent can do. Capabilities should match member capabilities. Example: agent with members [summarizer, qa] should have capabilities [summarize, qa]. Composition engine validates capability coverage.

title: Error handling and recovery
body: Common errors: PolicyViolation (check policies), NodeNotFound (register node first), DomainNotFound (create domain first), InvalidParameters (check required params). All errors include helpful recovery suggestions.

title: Offline operation mode
body: IAM operates offline by default. No external API calls. All knowledge from local NVM packs. No internet required. External calls require explicit user consent and policy approval.

title: Session management
body: Sessions stored in .hypersync/chat/sessions. Each session has unique ID. Sessions persist conversation context. Session data includes: messages, actions, telemetry. Sessions can be resumed or archived.

title: Rate limiting and throttling
body: Rate limit: 60 requests per minute, burst of 10. Prevents abuse and ensures fair resource usage. Rate limit errors include retry-after header. Adjust limits in model.manifest.json security section.

title: Sandbox security model
body: All operations run in sandbox. Sandbox restricts: file system access (only .hypersync/), network calls (requires consent), execution time (5s max). Sandbox prevents malicious operations.

title: Status and environment summary
body: status.summary provides overview: domains (LD list with node counts), total nodes, total agents. Useful for debugging and verification. Shows current HyperSync environment state.
